page.title: 19A Survey of Scartho. Part 5.
page.content: {Farming. The farms on the edge of the town are used for a variety of{arable farming, the chief crops being{wheat, {barley,}and{oil seed rape.}One field only is{pasture.}Running through this land is a track of a disused{railway which used to run between{Grimsby}and {Louth.}The land itself is quite hilly compared with the rest of our area and is crossed by pylons and a small stream known as{'Buck Beck'.}Some of the land has also been used to expand the housing estate. {Education. { }The{Fairfield}schools were built in{1968.}There is both a{First and a{Middle}school on the same site. Children attend these two schools between the ages of{5}years and{12 years. Then they go to a{Secondary school until the age of{16}years.
